subject: Travel
subcategory: The Story of Maps and Navigation
title: Autonomous Vehicle Navigation

hook.text: Self-driving cars don't see the world like humans. They build a 3D map of their surroundings 20 times per second.

buildup.text: LiDAR, cameras, radar, and ultrasonic sensors feed data to AI that decides steering, speed, and braking.

discovery.text: HD maps accurate to two centimeters are pre-loaded. The car compares real-time data against these maps.

twist.text: Construction, detours, and unmapped roads confuse autonomous systems. Human judgment is still essential.

climax.text: Waymo taxis now operate in Phoenix and San Francisco. Millions of miles have been driven without drivers.

punchline.text: Cars that drive themselves still need maps made by humans.

quiz.question: What kind of maps do self-driving cars use?
options: HD maps accurate to two centimeters
